criteria: Identifying and Reporting Bullying and Harassment
descriptions: Does not recognize or report instances of bullying or harassment.
Shows minimal recognition of bullying or harassment, but does not report it.
Recognizes bullying or harassment in obvious situations but hesitates to report or does so incompletely.
Identifies bullying and harassment and reports it with prompting or assistance.
Independently identifies and reports bullying and harassment, providing sufficient detail.
Proactively identifies, accurately reports, and takes appropriate action (e.g., seeks help from trusted adults) in bullying and harassment situations.
Does not recognize or report dangerous situations.
Shows minimal recognition of dangerous situations but does not report it.
Recognizes dangerous situations in obvious contexts but hesitates to report or does so incompletely.
Identifies dangerous situations and reports it with prompting or assistance.
Independently identifies and reports dangerous situations, providing relevant details.
Proactively identifies dangerous situations, reports them accurately, and takes immediate, appropriate action to ensure safety.
Demonstrates no understanding of reporting protocols or procedures.
Shows minimal awareness of reporting protocols, but cannot articulate them.
Understands some basic reporting protocols but is unsure of specific steps.
Demonstrates understanding of the steps to report dangerous situations.
Can accurately describe and follow reporting protocols for various dangerous situations.
Demonstrates thorough understanding of reporting protocols and can adapt them to novel or complex dangerous situations, while also assisting others in understanding these protocols.
